Controls.Label: List1
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the items on this page to define the braille symbol, type, order, and amount of information that will display in braille for a specific control. For example, for a radio button, the information that displays is control name, control state, control type, and position information.

Controls.Label: &Modify Control...
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose this button to open the Define dialog box for the selected control.

Controls.Label: Modify Braille &Symbol
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose this button to edit the braille symbol for the selected control.

Controls.Label: List1
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the items on this page to change how the states of a control are represented. Some examples of control states are checked, not checked, selected, and not selected.

Controls.Label: &Modify Braille Representation
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose this button to edit the braille representation for the selected state.

Controls.Label: List1
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the item on this page to change how JAWS uses braille to represent certain properties for HTML elements. You can control how JAWS indicates visited links, clickable elements, and elements with mouse overs.

Controls.Label: &Modify Braille HTML Representation
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose this button to edit the braille representation for the selected HTML attribute.

Controls.Label: Show on Display
Controls.HelpMsg: This dialog box contains two lists. The first, Show on Display, contains the information types that display for the control you select. These items are listed in the order that they are displayed in braille. The second list, Available to Add, shows the information types for the controls that are currently not displayed in braille. If you remove an information type from the Show on Display list, it is added to the Available to Add list. The buttons let you change the order of the information in the Show on Display list, and remove items from that list. When you remove an item from the Show on Display list, it will not be displayed in braille for the selected type of control.

Controls.Label: &Remove
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose this button to move an item from the Show On list to the Available To list.

Controls.Label: &Up
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose this button to move the current item higher up in the Show On list.

Controls.Label: &Down
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose this button to move the current item down in the Show On list.

Controls.Label: Available to Add
Controls.HelpMsg: This dialog box contains two lists. The first, Show on Display, contains the information types that display for the control you select. These items are listed in the order that they are displayed in braille. The second list, Available to Add, shows the information types for the controls that are currently not displayed in braille. If you remove an information type from the Show on Display list, it is added to the Available to Add list. The buttons let you change the order of the information in the Show on Display list, and remove items from that list. When you remove an item from the Show on Display list, it will not be displayed in braille for the selected type of control.

Controls.Label: &Add
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose this button to add an item from the Available To list to the Show On list.

Controls.Label: &OK
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose this button to save changes and close the dialog box.

Controls.Label: &Cancel
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose this button to ignore changes and close the dialog box.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to configure Text Analyzer, which is a tool that can identify errors in a document by using a spoken message or WAV file alert. Items such as unmatched parentheses, unintentional format changes, extra whitespace, and stray or unspaced punctuation are considered errors. These can often be missed when using speech alone. This feature is off by default.

Controls.Label: &Text Analyzer
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the radio buttons in this group to determine the type of alert used to indicate errors when editing or proofreading a document by line, sentence, paragraph, or Say All command. Select Indicate with Sound to play a WAV file when a formatting error is detected. Select Speak Count to announce the number of inconsistencies in the current text. Select Describe Inconsistencies for a description of the error. The default setting is off.

Controls.Label: Indicate &Mismatched Symbols
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to enable the detection of mismatched symbols such as parenthesis, braces, brackets, angle brackets, and quotes. If this check box is cleared, the items in the Symbols to Check  group are not available.

Controls.Label: Symbols to Check
Controls.HelpMsg: Select one or more check boxes to search for mismatched parentheses, braces, brackets, angle brackets, or quotes where the equivalent opening or closing symbol is missing. These check boxes are only available when the Indicate Mismatched Symbols check box is selected.

Controls.Label: &Parenthesis
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to search for missing or mismatched parentheses. This option is only available when Indicate Mismatched Symbols is selected.

Controls.Label: &Japanese Parenthesis
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to search for mismatched Japanese parentheses in Japanese text. This option is only available when Indicate Mismatched Symbols is selected.

Controls.Label: &Braces
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to search for missing or mismatched braces.  This option is only available when Indicate Mismatched Symbols is selected.

Controls.Label: B&rackets
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to search for missing or mismatched brackets.  This option is only available when Indicate Mismatched Symbols is selected.

Controls.Label: A&ngle Brackets
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to search for missing or mismatched angle brackets.  This option is only available when Indicate Mismatched Symbols is selected.

Controls.Label: I&gnore Solitary Paired Symbol
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to ignore a line of text that contains unmatched braces or parentheses. This is acceptable when using programming editors where it is normal to have lone symbols in a line of code. This option is only available when Indicate Mismatched Symbols is selected.

Controls.Label: &Quotes
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to search for missing or mismatched quotes.  This option is only available when Indicate Mismatched Symbols is selected.

Controls.Label: &Inverted Marks
Controls.HelpMsg:
Select this check box to search for mismatched, inverted, and
non-inverted question marks as well as inverted and non-inverted exclamation marks in Spanish text. This option is only available when Indicate Mismatched Symbols is selected.

Controls.Label: Inconsistencies to Check
Controls.HelpMsg: Select one or more check boxes to identify inconsistencies with stray punctuation, extra spaces, missing capital letters, or inverted lowercase and uppercase text.

Controls.Label: &Stray Punctuation
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to search for and indicate stray punctuation in the current text.

Controls.Label: R&uns of Spaces
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to search for and indicate extra spaces between words in the current text.

Controls.Label: Missing &Capitals
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to search for and indicate missing capital letters in the current text.

Controls.Label: Inverte&d Capitals
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to search for and indicate inverted lowercase and uppercase letters in the current text.  For example, the first letter of a proper noun is lowercase while the rest of the word is uppercase.

Controls.Label: Font Changes to Check
Controls.HelpMsg: Select one or more check boxes to identify incorrect font changes in the current text including name, size, attributes, and colors.

Controls.Label: Nam&e
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to have JAWS indicate a change in the font name as an inconsistency while scanning your document.

Controls.Label: Si&ze
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to have JAWS indicate a change in the font size as an inconsistency while scanning your document.

Controls.Label: &Attributes
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to have JAWS indicate a change in the font attributes (such as bold, italic, underline, etc.) as an inconsistency while scanning your document.

Controls.Label: C&olor
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to have JAWS indicate a change in the text or background color as an inconsistency while scanning your document.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to specify how graphics and special symbols are announced.

Controls.Label: Announce Special Symbols &When
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this combo box to determine when special characters are announced. Some special characters are always announced. For example, the symbols for Copyright, Registered, and Trademark are always read by JAWS. Select Never so that most special characters are not announced. This is the default setting. Select Type Echo, Say Char, Spell Word so that most special characters are announced when typing, when reading by character, or when spelling a word. Select Also Say Word so that special characters are announced when reading by word, in addition to typing, reading by character, or spelling. Select Also Say All so that special characters are announced when reading using the Say All command, in addition to typing, reading by character, word, or line, or spelling.

Controls.Label: Speak Character Value in &Hex
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to configure how JAWS announces the hexadecimal value of the current character instead of the ASCII value when you press NUM PAD 5 three times quickly. This check box is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: Speak Character Value As Sequence Of &Multibyte Values
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this option to determine how JAWS speaks the value of unicode characters. Clear the check box to have JAWS speak the value of characters as is (for example, "u+627 hex"). Select this check box to have JAWS convert the character into a sequence (according to the current active codepage) and speak the value of each of the component characters. This check box is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: Graphic &Verbosity
Controls.HelpMsg:
Use the radio buttons in this group to choose how graphics in documents and files are announced. Select All Graphics to have JAWS announce all graphics in a document. If a graphic has a label, the label is read.  If it does not have a label, JAWS assigns and reads a unique number that identifies the graphic. Select Labeled Graphics to have JAWS only announce labeled graphics. If you select No Graphics, JAWS will not announce any graphics in the document.
The default setting is to announce labeled graphics.

Controls.Label: Graphic Recognition Dimensions
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to determine minimums and maximums for both the height and width in pixels for graphics. Values outside of these ranges are not recognized.

Controls.Label: Minimum H&eight
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this edit box to set the minimum pixel height for a graphic. JAWS will not recognize a graphic height less than this value. The default is 10 pixels. Press F6 to move directly to the edit box to change this setting.

Controls.Label: Minimum W&idth
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this edit box to set the minimum pixel width for a graphic. JAWS will not recognize a graphic width less than this value. The default is 10 pixels. Press F6 to move directly to the edit box to change this setting.

Controls.Label: Maximum Hei&ght
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this edit box to set the maximum pixel height for a graphic. JAWS will not recognize a graphic height greater than this value. The default is 64 pixels. Press F6 to move directly to the edit box to change this setting.

Controls.Label: Maximum Wid&th
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this edit box to set the maximum pixel width for a graphic. JAWS will not recognize a graphic width greater than this value. The default is 64 pixels. Press F6 to move directly to the edit box to change this setting.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to control functionality that launches when you start JAWS or your computer.

Controls.Label: Automatic Notification of Updates
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to have JAWS indicate when an update is available.  You then have the option to install it now or later. When this check box is cleared, you will not be alerted when software updates are available.  In this case, you must manually check for updates using the update feature in the JAWS Help menu.  This check box is selected by default.

HelpMsg: Use the items in this group to configure settings for OCR and Picture Smart.

Controls.Label: &Primary Recognition Language
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this item to specify the language used to read and decipher text. Select the language that corresponds to the language of the printed page you are acquiring. This allows correct recognition of characters (such as accent marks and umlauts) unique to that language.

Controls.Label: &Secondary Recognition Language
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this item to specify a second recognition language used to recognize acquired text. It uses the languages selected for both the primary and secondary options to recognize text. This is helpful if the document contains text from more than one language.

Controls.Label: Picture Smart &Language
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this item to specify the language used by the Picture Smart feature for displaying image descriptions.

Controls.Label: Use &Microsoft Ocr For Screen Recognitions
Controls.HelpMsg:
When selected, the Convenient OCR commands to recognize the current control, current window, or entire screen uses the Microsoft OCR engine for the recognition process.
This check box is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: Microsoft &Ocr Language
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this combo box to specify the language used to recognize text with the Microsoft OCR engine. Available languages are determined by the Preferred Languages list in the Windows Language Settings.

Controls.Label: Select Preferred Braille Profiles.
Controls.HelpMsg: This list contains all available braille profiles. Each item in the list is checkable. If a profile is selected, it is added to the list of preferred profiles in the Select a Braille Profile dialog box (CTRL+SHIFT+WINDOWS+L). Press the SPACEBAR on a profile to add or remove it from the list.

Controls.Label: &Set Primary
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose this button to make the currently selected preferred braille profile the primary profile.

Controls.Label: &Details...
Controls.HelpMsg:
Choose this option to open the Profile Details dialog box where you can configure braille translation mode settings for the currently selected braille profile in the list.
Press SPACEBAR to open the dialog box.

Controls.Label: &Link Braille Input Language To Keyboard Language
Controls.HelpMsg:
Select this check box to have JAWS use the appropriate braille input language that matches the currently active keyboard language. For example, if you switch the keyboard language to Spanish (ALT+SHIFT), JAWS automatically switches to Spanish braille, so you can continue entering text from your display in the correct language.
This check box is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: &Automatic Language Detection
Controls.HelpMsg:
Select this check box to have JAWS use the appropriate braille output language that matches the current language of text in a document or web page. For example, if JAWS detects text in a document written in Spanish, JAWS automatically switches to displaying the text in Spanish braille using the output translation mode setting configured in the Language Preferences dialog box for the Spanish profile.
This check box is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: &OK
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose this button to save changes and close the dialog box.

Controls.Label: &Cancel
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose this button to ignore changes and close the dialog box.

Controls.Label: &For Contracted Braille, Use
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose the grade of braille to use when reading and typing contracted braille. The available options depend on the currently selected profile. For instance, Unified English Braille (UEB) Grade 1 or Grade 2 are not available when configuring the Spanish language profile.

Controls.Label: For &Output, Use
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this combo box to select a legacy Braille table (JBT) to be used when displaying text in Computer Braille.

Controls.Label: For &Input, Use
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this combo box to select a legacy Braille table (JBT) to be used when entering text in Computer Braille.

Controls.Label: By &Default, Use
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this combo box to choose which translation mode to use. The available choices are to use Computer Braille for both input and output, Computer Braille for input and Contracted Braille for output, or Contracted Braille for both input and output. You can also quickly toggle between translation modes for the active profile by using DOTS 1-2-4-5-7 CHORD on a Focus braille display.

Controls.Label: For &Math, Use
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this combo box to choose the Braille math code to use when displaying math content. Nemeth is selected by default.

Controls.Label: &Use Liblouis for Computer Braille
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to use the computer braille tables provided by the Liblouis braille translator instead of the JAWS legacy computer braille tables. This check box is cleared by default for all languages except Dutch - Belgium.

Controls.Label: Su&ppress Capital Signs
Controls.HelpMsg: When displaying text using one of the contracted braille translation modes, select this check box to not show capital signs for the selected language. This option is cleared by default.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to configure touch screen gesture recognizer settings.

Controls.Label: &Explore Delay
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this slider to increase or decrease the time interval between when the finger touches the surface of the touch screen and when JAWS enters explore mode. Press F6 to access this slider and then use the ARROW keys to change the value.

Controls.Label: &Double Tap Speed
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this slider to increase or decrease the time interval between individual taps in a double or triple tap. Press F6 to access this slider and then use the ARROW keys to change the value.

Controls.Label: &Tap Radius
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this slider to increase or decrease the size of the finger contact spot on the touch screen. Press F6 to access this slider and then use the ARROW keys to change the value.

Controls.Label: &Flick Velocity
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this slider to increase or decrease the minimum finger velocity on the touch screen above which the movement is recognized as a flick. Press F6 to access this slider and then use the ARROW keys to change the value.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to configure JAWS settings related to the touch keyboard such as typing mode, touch keyboard typing echo, and notifications.

Controls.Label: Touch &Typing Mode
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose which typing mode to use for the touch keyboard. With Standard Typing, a key is typed when the screen is double tapped after exploring to any of the keyboard buttons. With Touch Typing, a key is typed when the finger is lifted from any of the keyboard buttons. In either mode, a key may be typed by performing a split tap on a keyboard button. The default typing mode is Touch Typing.

Controls.Label: Touch T&yping Echo
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the radio buttons in this group to determine how much feedback is received when typing using the touch keyboard. You may choose either Characters, Words, Both Characters and Words, or None so that JAWS remains silent as you type using the touch keyboard. This option enables you to configure the feedback for the touch keyboard separate from the feedback for the physical keyboard. The default typing echo for the touch keyboard is Both Characters and Words.

Controls.Label: Touch &Keyboard Notification
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this option to configure how you will be notified when the touch keyboard appears and disappears from the screen. If you choose to be notified by a spoken message, JAWS announces "Opened touch keyboard" when the keyboard appears and "Closed touch keyboard" when it disappears. If you choose to be notified by sound, an ascending sound will play when the keyboard appears and a descending sound will play when it disappears. By default, you will be notified by both a spoken message and a sound when the keyboard appears and disappears.

Controls.Label: Touch &Alternative Character Panel Popup Notification
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this option to configure how you will be notified when a panel of keys for alternative characters related to the current keyboard button appears. An ascending sound will play when the panel of keys for alternative characters opens, and a descending sound will play when it closes. If you choose to be notified by both message and sound, which is the default setting, a message will be spoken along with the panel open sound; otherwise, only the sound will be played to notify you of the panel opening and closing.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to configure JAWS settings for physical keyboards as well as the Windows touch keyboard.
Use the options in this group to configure settings for mouse echo.

Controls.Label: Enable &Mouse Echo
Controls.HelpMsg: When enabled, JAWS speaks text as you point to it with the mouse. Mouse echo is off by default when only JAWS is running and on by default when using Fusion.

Controls.Label: Mouse Echo &Interrupt
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to allow JAWS to interrupt speech when you move the mouse pointer over text. If you clear this check box, you can move the mouse pointer anywhere on the screen without interrupting speech. This check box is selected by default.

Controls.Label: Mouse Echo I&nstant
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to have text read while the mouse is in motion so you do not have to pause to hear the text under the mouse. Clearing this check box causes JAWS to wait for the amount of time specified in the Mouse Echo Delay combo box before reading the text under the mouse pointer. This check box is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: Mouse Echo &Delay
Controls.HelpMsg: Specify the length of time JAWS waits before it reads the text at the location of the mouse pointer. The delay is measured in seconds. If you move the mouse pointer away before the delay has elapsed, JAWS does not read the text. The default mouse echo delay is 0.4 seconds. This option is not available if the Mouse Echo Instant check box is selected which means text is read while the mouse is in motion so you do not have to pause to hear the text under the mouse.

Controls.Label: Mouse &Echo Unit
Controls.HelpMsg: Select the unit of text you want to hear when the mouse pointer pauses over text in a control. If the control cannot provide the requested unit of text, then JAWS will read all of the text provided by the control. The default mouse echo unit is Line.

Controls.Label: &Speak description of item
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to have JAWS speak descriptive information provided by the control that contains the text at the mouse pointer. This information will be spoken after the text at the mouse pointer is spoken. Note that descriptive text is not always available. This check box is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: Speak &control type and state of item
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to have JAWS speak the control type and state of the control containing the text at the mouse pointer when applicable. This information will be spoken after the text at the mouse pointer is spoken. This check box is selected by default.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to configure settings for visual tracking when JAWS is running by itself. When used with Fusion, visual highlighting is controlled by ZoomText.

Controls.Label: Highlight Virtual &Ribbon
Controls.HelpMsg:
If the Virtual Ribbon Menu is enabled, select this check box to have JAWS highlight each item as you navigate to help visually determine the currently selected menu item. This option is selected by default.
Press F6 to move to the Visual Tracking Pane to define attributes of the highlight including color, style (box, block, or underline), transparency, thickness, and spacing.

Controls.Label: Highlight &Virtual PC Cursor
Controls.HelpMsg:
When navigating web pages, PDF documents, or email messages with the Virtual PC Cursor, select this check box to have JAWS highlight the currently selected text as it speaks. This allows you to easily follow the text visually while JAWS reads. This option is selected by default in Internet Explorer, Chrome, Firefox, Adobe Reader, and Microsoft Mail.
Press F6 to move to the Visual Tracking Pane to define attributes of the highlight including color, style (box, block, or underline), transparency, thickness, and spacing.

Controls.Label: Highlight &Touch Cursor
Controls.HelpMsg:
When navigating using the Touch Cursor or touch gestures, select this check box to have JAWS highlight the currently selected item to visually indicate the location of the Touch Cursor. This option is selected by default.
Press F6 to move to the Visual Tracking Pane to define attributes of the highlight including color, style (box, block, or underline), transparency, thickness, and spacing.

Controls.Label: Visual Settings
Controls.HelpMsg: Use these settings to configure the color, style, transparency, thickness, and spacing for the visual highlight.

Controls.Label: &Color
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose the color to use for the visual highlight. The default color is lime green.

Controls.Label: &Style
Controls.HelpMsg:
Select one of the following styles to use for the visual highlight:
Box - Places a rectangular outline around the text as it is spoken.
Block - Uses a solid rectangle to highlight text as it is spoken.
Underline - Underlines text as it is spoken.
The default style is Block.

Controls.Label: Tr&ansparency
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this slider to increase or decrease the level of opacity for the visual highlight around the selected text. Higher levels of transparency allow you to see text and images beneath the overlay. Press F6 to access this slider and then use the ARROW keys to change the value.

Controls.Label: Thic&kness
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this slider to increase or decrease the border thickness of the box and underline styles. Thicker borders are easier to see and stand out more. Thinner borders are more subdued and let you see more of the text. Press F6 to access this slider and then use the ARROW keys to change the value.

Controls.Label: S&pacing
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this slider to increase or decrease the amount of white space between the selected text and the highlight border for the box, block, and underline styles. Press F6 to access this slider and then use the ARROW keys to change the value.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to choose the speech mode as well as configure less speech options and Speech On Demand. Speech On Demand restricts speech to a limited set of reading keystrokes, mouse echo, and typing echo.

Controls.Label: Speech Mode
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the radio buttons in this group to select the speech mode. Full Speech lets JAWS speak normally. Less Speech limits speech output according to the Less Speech Options group. The default setting is Full Speech. This setting can also be toggled by pressing INSERT+SPACEBAR followed by S.

Controls.Label: Less Speech Options
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the radio buttons in this group to configure whether or not you hear speech output when JAWS is set to less speech. Choose Speech On Demand to allow a limited set of actions to produce speech output. Choose Mute Speech to completely turn off all JAWS speech. The default setting is Speech On Demand. This setting can also be toggled by pressing INSERT+SPACE followed by SHIFT+S.

Controls.Label: Play &JAWS Sounds
Controls.HelpMsg:
When this check box is selected, JAWS generated sounds will continue to be heard when Speech On Demand or Mute Speech is active. This includes the sound heard when pressing INSERT+SPACEBAR to perform a layered keystroke as well as the sound heard when completing an address in Outlook.
Clear this check box if you do not want to hear JAWS sounds when using Speech On Demand or Mute Speech.
This check box is selected by default.

Controls.Label: Speech On Demand Options
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to configure which items are spoken when using Speech On Demand.

Controls.Label: Allow Reading Commands
Controls.HelpMsg: When selected, this option allows a limited set of reading keystrokes to speak when Less Speech mode is active and Speech On Demand is enabled. Some available commands include speaking the current character (NUM PAD 5), word (INSERT+NUM PAD 5), line (INSERT+UP ARROW), or Say All (INSERT+DOWN ARROW). This check box is selected by default.

Controls.Label: Allow Mouse Echo
Controls.HelpMsg: If Mouse Echo is enabled, selecting this option allows text to be spoken as you move the mouse when Less Speech mode is active and Speech On Demand is enabled. This check box is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: Allow Typing Echo
Controls.HelpMsg: If Typing Echo is set to Characters, Words, or Characters and Words, select this option to have JAWS speak as you type when Less Speech mode is active and Speech On Demand is enabled. This check box is cleared by default.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to configure Braille and Text Viewer settings.
Use the options in this group to configure settings shared by both the Braille and Text viewers.

Controls.Label: Window Settings
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to specify the onscreen position of the Braille and Text viewers.

Controls.Label: &Position
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose whether the Braille and Text Viewers are shown at the top or bottom of the screen. The default position is Top of Screen.

Controls.Label: &Monitor
Controls.HelpMsg:
If you are using more than one monitor, use this option to choose which monitor will display the Braille and Text Viewers.
Note that this setting is not used when running as Fusion. Instead, the monitor that will display the Braille and Text Viewers will depend on the Window Mode setting in Fusion.

Controls.Label: Font Settings
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to configure font settings.

Controls.Label: &Font
Controls.HelpMsg: Select a font to use for the Braille and Text Viewers. The default font is Segoe UI.

Controls.Label: &Size
Controls.HelpMsg: Select the size of the text for the Braille and Text Viewers. The default text size is 20.

Controls.Label: Color Settings
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to configure various color settings.

Controls.Label: &Text Color
Controls.HelpMsg: Select the color of the text for the Braille and Text Viewers. The default text color is black.

Controls.Label: &Custom Color...
Controls.HelpMsg: This option opens a dialog box where you can choose a custom text color for the Braille and Text Viewers.

Controls.Label: &Background Color
Controls.HelpMsg: Select the background color for the Braille and Text Viewers. The default background color is white.

Controls.Label: Cust&om Color...
Controls.HelpMsg: This option opens a dialog box where you can choose a custom background color for the Braille and Text Viewers.

Controls.Label: &Highlight Color
Controls.HelpMsg: Select the highlight color for the Braille and Text Viewers. The default highlight color is Pale Cyan.

Controls.Label: Custom Co&lor...
Controls.HelpMsg: This option opens a dialog box where you can choose a custom highlight color for the Braille and Text Viewers.

Controls.Label: Hi&ghlighted Text Color
Controls.HelpMsg: Select the color of highlighted text for the Braille and Text Viewers. The default highlighted text color is black.

Controls.Label: C&ustom Color...
Controls.HelpMsg: This option opens a dialog box where you can choose a custom highlighted text color for the Braille and Text Viewers.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to configure settings specific to the Braille Viewer.

Controls.Label: Show &Braille Viewer
Controls.HelpMsg:
Select this check box to show the Braille Viewer. You can also toggle the Braille Viewer on or off using the layered command INSERT+SPACEBAR, followed by B, and then B.
This check box is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: Show Braille Viewer for &Fusion
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to show the Braille Viewer only when Fusion is running. This check box is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: &View Style
Controls.HelpMsg:
Choose how you want braille output to be shown in the viewer. You can display the braille output as text, show the actual braille dot patterns, or choose to see both text and braille dots.
By default, boht text and dot patterns are displayed.

Controls.Label: Show &Status Cells
Controls.HelpMsg:
Status cells are used on a braille display to show additional information such as your current position in a document, the active cursor, the type of element currently selected on a web page, and more. When this check box is selected, the informational status cells are shown to the left of the braille output. Clear this check box if you do not want to see the status cells.
This check box is selected by default.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to configure settings specific to the Text Viewer.

Controls.Label: Show Text &Viewer
Controls.HelpMsg:
Select this check box to show the Text Viewer. You can also toggle the Text Viewer on or off using the layered command INSERT+SPACEBAR, followed by B, and then T.
This check box is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: Show Text Viewer for &Fusion
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to show the Text Viewer only when Fusion is running. This check box is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: &Tracking Style
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this option to determine how text is shown in the Text Viewer as the cursor moves. The default setting is Auto Advance.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to configure how the time from the system clock is shown in the status cells of your braille display.

Controls.Label: Show Time in Status Cells
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to continuously show the time from the system clock in the status cells of your Braille display. You can also toggle this option by pressing INSERT+SHIFT+F12 or LEFT SHIFT+RIGHT SHIFT+DOTS 1-2-3 on a Focus braille display. This option is cleared by default and is only available in the default settings file.

Controls.Label: 24 Hour Format
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to show the clock in the status cells of your braille display using 24 hour time. This option is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: Time Format
Controls.HelpMsg: Choose the time format to show in the status cells of your braille display. Available options are Hours and Minutes or Minutes and Seconds. The default time format is Hours and Minutes. This option can be configured for specific applications.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to determine how glance highlights are announced when reading Web pages, HTML files, and PDF files.

Controls.Label: &Indicate Smart Glance Highlights
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this option to define when glance highlights are announced. The text segments of the glance highlights list are characterized by their visual design. The default setting is On Page Load, which means that JAWS indicates the number of glance highlights as soon as a page finishes loading.

Controls.Label: &Sensitivity
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this option to increase the sensitivity for determining a glance highlight. With a higher sensitivity, more results are displayed by also analyzing smaller text segments for special text attributes.

Controls.Label: Include Elements
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to choose which HTML elements are included when analyzing a Web page for glance highlights.

Controls.Label: &Links
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to include links in the list of glance highlights. This check box is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: &Headings
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to include headings in the list of glance highlights. This check box is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: &Form Fields
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to include form fields in the list of glance highlights. This check box is cleared by default.

Controls.Label: &Required Fields
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to include required fields in the list of glance highlights. This check box is selected by default.

Controls.Label: I&nvalid Fields
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this check box to include invalid fields in the list of glance highlights. This check box is selected by default.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to specify how Face in View starts.

Controls.Label: &Automatically begin announcing face orientation when an active camera is detected
Controls.HelpMsg:
When this check box is selected, JAWS automatically begins announcing face orientation as soon as an active camera is detected.
Clear this option if you want to start Face in View manually using the layered command, INSERT+SPACEBAR, F, O.

Controls.Label: &Start Seamless Experience minimized
Controls.HelpMsg:
When Face In View starts, the window displaying orientation and brightness information will be minimized.
Clear this check box if you want the Face In View window to appear in the foreground when started.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to configure how JAWS reads math content.
Use the options in this group to determine how much information JAWS speaks when reading math expressions.

Controls.Label: &Speech Style
Controls.HelpMsg:
Use the radio buttons in this group to set the speech style for math content.
Select ClearSpeak to hear the full expression with all symbols and terms spoken. For example, you might enable this setting when taking an exam or completing a class assignment .
Selecting SimpleSpeak attempts to streamline speech by omitting the announcement of symbols such as brackets whenever possible.

Controls.Label: Math &Verbosity
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the radio buttons in this group to control verbosity for math. Example: the square root of x is spoken as square root of x when Verbose is selected, and square root x when Terse is selected.

HelpMsg: Use the option in this group to specify how math content is highlighted in Braille.

Controls.Label: &Braille Navigation Highlight
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the radio buttons in this group to control how the currently selected math element is highlighted in Braille. Off means no highlight, First Character means that the highlight is at the first character, Endpoints means that the highlight is at the first and final characters, and All means that the entire element is highlighted.

Controls.Label: Braille &Math Code
Controls.HelpMsg: Use this combo box to choose the Braille math code to use when displaying math content. Nemeth is selected by default.

HelpMsg: Use the options in this group to configure settings for navigating math content.

Controls.Label: &Navigation Mode
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the radio buttons in this group to control the navigation mode for math. Enhanced mode moves between mathematically meaningful pieces such as operators and delimiters. Simple mode moves between words, except when an expression such as a fraction or square root is encountered. In this case, the entire expression is read. Character mode moves between words but allows you to move between characters by moving one level down.

Controls.Label: Navigation &Verbosity
Controls.HelpMsg: Use the radio buttons in this group to control how much JAWS speaks as you move between items in a math expression.

Controls.Label: &Zoom out of Expressions Automatically
Controls.HelpMsg: Select this checkbox to automatically move out of mathematical expressions when you've reached their edge while navigating. This check box is cleared by default.

HelpMsg: This group contains the last 25 options that were recently changed for an application. When you select an item in the tree view, its corresponding settings appear in the configuration display pane on the right side of the Settings Center window. Press SPACEBAR to select check boxes, radio buttons, or other buttons, and press F6 to switch between an edit box and the tree view to change settings. Note that once this group has 25 items, the last setting in the list is deleted when another item is added. To remove an item from the list, select it, press SHIFT+F10, and then select Remove. To remove all items from the list, select the Last Changed Settings group in the tree view, press SHIFT+F10, and then select Remove All.
